Articles.Content: I know that Game Informer likes it, and I happen to also be fine with the endings (watched them on YouTube), but Nerdcubed doesn't exactly like it. So, is it good? If the case, can you change the keys to stop the whole "PRESS SPACE TO DO EVERYTHING" thing?
Why would you watch the endings if you intended to play it for yourself?

Why would you watch the endings if you intended to play it for yourself?

Many people were complaining about them and some liked them, so I decided to see what I would think of them. My favorite happens to be the one where Shepard takes control of the Reapers and has them repair everything.

I don't think there would have been such an uproar if it wasn't so blatantly obvious what you where choosing, it was like an in-game chat selection, like the ones you got when talking to people.

Anyway, the game is pretty darn good through out, but that ending dude.

Man, I wanna say it didn't ruin it, but it kinda did, it was just sad to see all the stuff you went through being dropped on the floor like that, like it didn't even matter.

95% of the game was amazing. And then you beat the area just before the final mission... and it just all starts falling apart. The main reason I hated the ending was that it made all of your choices completely irrelevant. If you got a high enough war readiness, you unlocked a third choice, but otherwise none of it had any effect whatsoever on the ending. Which I thought was a stupid way to end a series in which the main attraction is making difficult choices that affect the universe around you and then living with the consequences.

So if you're fine with playing through the game already knowing the ending, it's worth it. Like I said, 95% of the game was amazing.
